intro: Doxema sanguinea, commonly known as the red-stemmed doxema, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Doxema sanguinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
